title: About REG
text: The Research Engineering Group is a community of practice at the University of Bristol. It includes interdisciplinary data scientists, research software engineers, research infrastructure engineers, data engineers and friends.

title: About REG
text:
What we do
Our main ways of communicating are by:

Slack channel, #bristol-reg, on the UK RSE Slack instance. We encourage use of the Slack for peer-to-peer support (and photos of pets!) The UK RSE slack also brings together the UK-wide RSE and friends community. If you’re new, then there are lots of helpful channels on this Slack instance and it’s a very active community.
Group meetings, hybrid in Royal Fort House on the last Tuesday of every month, usually 3-4pm.
Mailing list, which also has a group calendar for our meetings.

title: About REG
text:
Other things we do

Reading group - every month we review and discuss an article voted on by the group. These sessions are usually hybrid.
Research computing training for data science and RSE. Self-led courses on GitHub plus we run in-person and online courses during the year. Volunteer helpers welcome!

title: About REG
text:
Also of interest

Data Ethics Club online journal club about doing data science ethically, every two weeks.
Alan Turing Institute liaison academics linking the University of Bristol to the wider Turing network and interest groups, for example.
Today I Learned (TIL) GitHub repo – for making interesting things we talk about on Slack more permanent, with minimal fuss. See the ‘contributing TILs’ for instructions.
Data Science Handbook GitHub website – in development and contributions welcome!

title: Contacts for REG and joining instructions
text:
The Research Engineering Group is run by the team at the Jean Golding Institute.
You can contact the organisers by email: jgi-reseng@bristol.ac.uk.

title: Contacts for REG and joining instructions
text:
Join our group
Membership of the group is open to anyone at the University of Bristol that considers themselves within the research engineering remit.
To join:

Sign up to the UK RSE Slack instance.
Once you have signed up, email us for an invite to the #bristol-reg channel and to be added to our mailing list.

So that we can introduce you to existing members, please consider including in your email:

that you’re interested in joining REG
what you areas of interest are
anything you’d like to get out of being in the group.

title: Membership of REG
text:
We have over 30 members, including from:

Jean Golding Institute
Bristol Centre for Supercomputing
IT Services, including the Advanced Computing Research Centre and Research IT
LEAP Digital Health Hub
and embedded researchers across the University.

Many of our members are research-active, or actively work in areas that support research projects at the University.

title: Research Engineering Group at the University of Bristol
text:
About the group


The Research Engineering Group is a community of practice at the University of Bristol, providing peer support and training.

















Our membership


Many of our members are research-active, or actively work in areas that support research projects at the University.

















Contact us and join the group


Membership of the group is open to anyone at the University of Bristol that considers themselves within the research engineering remit.
